page-products-intro: Increase profits by transcoding video on GPUs while mining.
page-products-how-text-one: Run a node on the Candle network that advertises the price it will charge for video transcoding. Continue your cryptocurrency mining with your GPUs.
page-products-how-text-two: When video encoding jobs come your way, the Candle node routes the tasks to your GPUs, and the encoding leverages a different part of the GPUs than the mining, so the mining can also continue with minimal hashrate loss. No opportunity cost!
page-products-numbers-text: The capacity on Candle's network represents access to 70,000+ GPUs, or enough to encode all the realtime video streaming through Twitch, Facebook, and Youtube combined.
page-products-requirements-intro: To become a video miner you must have the following:
page-products-requirements-text-one: See our support matrix and community discussion
page-products-requirements-text-two: With good connectivity to major internet service providers
page-products-requirements-title-three: Ability to run a blockchain aware Candle node 24/7
page-products-requirements-text-three: If not interested in this piece, look at partnering with an existing node operator
page-products-get-started-intro: Become a video miner in three steps.
page-products-get-started-one: Read the docs for transcoding on the livepeer network
page-products-get-started-two: Check out the video miner FAQ
page-products-get-started-three: Reach out to the Candle team and community in the Discord chat room, #transcoding channel. Initial testing and setup can require some DevOps, so we are happy to help.
